repnme.cdata!:
Ghana - Trade and Investment Gateway
            Project (GHATIG)

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Trade and
            Investment Gateway Project for Ghana is to attract a
            critical mass of export oriented investors to Ghana to
            accelerate export-led growth and to facilitate trade. This
            is a project performance assessment report by the
            Independent Evaluation Group (IEG), to ensure the integrity
            of the Bank's self-evaluation process and to verify
            that the Bank's work is producing the expected results,
            and to help develop improved directions, policies, and
            procedures through the dissemination of lessons drawn from
            experience. Findings indicate that the project outcome was
            deemed moderately satisfactory. The relevance of the
            objectives is rated as substantial, but the relevance of the
            design was modest. The achievement of the development
            objectives of attracting export-oriented investment and
            facilitating trade was substantial. Bank performance is
            rated moderately unsatisfactory, mainly reflecting the mixed
            quality at entry and quality of supervision. Borrower
            performance is rated moderately satisfactory, both for the
            government and the implementing agencies. The assessment
            deduced that: 1) 'Free Zones' are more likely to
            be inefficient where fiscal incentives are nationwide; 2)
            effective market research and flexible project design are
            crucial elements for the success of public-private
            partnership projects; and 3) institutional reforms and trade
            logistics improvement can play a significant role in
            facilitating trade.

docna.cdata!: Ghana - Trade and Investment Gateway Project (GHATIG)

Ghana - Trade and Investment

            ENV. ACTIVITIES IN SSA - PHASE III,TF039569-GHANA - TRADE AND INVESTMENT GATEWAY

repnme.cdata!:
Development of a Ghana multipurpose
            industrial park for improvement of the quality and standards
            of services delivered to investors and exporters

abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile focuses on the
            improvement of the quality and standards of services
            delivered to investors and exporters of Ghana. The main
            challenge was to create an industrial base for Ghana. The
            Trade and Investment Gateway Project invested in physical
            and institutional linkages between the port, the Export
            Processing Zone (EPZ), and the Multipurpose Industrial Park
            (MPIP) for trade promotion. It produced integrative
            multi-polar special economic zones (SEZ) in Tema and a
            capillary of free zones enterprises in the rest of the
            country. As a result, thousands of job opportunities were
            created, and export revenue increased. The discovery and
            exploitation of oil and gas in Ghana, the integration of
            local competitiveness platforms had been an appropriate
            approach to industrial policy and structural change. The
            platforms helped to build integrative economic clusters in
            the Ghana Western Corridor, support growth, and foster the
            country’s sustainable participation in globalization.

repnme.cdata!: Ghana - Trade and Investment Gateway Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Trade and Investment
            Gateway Project for Ghana were as follows: outcomes were
            moderately satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            moderate, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: private developers for Export Processing
            Zone (EPZ) do not have to be international. Attracting firms
            to the EPZ does not have to be led by an international
            private developer. The international private developer
            failed to perform and the national developers took over and
            the EPZ is fully operational. Timely restructuring of a
            project can lead to a successful implementation of a
            project. When a project becomes very difficult to implement
            it's usually a sign that there is a need to revisit the
            fundamentals of the design and its concepts to enable
            retrofitting or adjustments of key features of the project
            for it to work.

repnme.cdata!: Ghana - Trade Gateway and Investment Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Trade Gateway and Investment Project
            for Ghana aims to: (a) the development of a multi-purpose
            industrial park (MPIP); and (b) the improvement of the
            quality and standards of services delivered to investors and
            to exporters by the Borrower's institutions and
            agencies responsible for trade and investment aiming to
            attract a critical mass of export-oriented firms and
            facilitate trade in the territory of the Borrower for
            accelerated growth.

5077348.trustfund:
TF025166-PHRD-INDUSTRIAL INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECT,TF024803-ENVIRON. ECONOMICS & EAS -
            ENV. ACTIVITIES IN SSA - PHASE III,TF039569-GHANA - TRADE AND INVESTMENT GATEWAY
5077348.majtheme: Financial and private sector development,Trade and integration

abstracts.cdata!:
The Trade and Investment Gateway Project
            (GHATIG) aims to attract a critical mass of export-oriented
            investors to Ghana to accelerate export-led growth as well
            as facilitate trade. There are two main components. The
            first finances feasibility studies of a railway corridor and
            marshaling yard, and detailed engineering, construction, and
            supervision of the off-site infrastructure for the Tema
            export-processing zone, including constructing access roads,
            side drainage, and associated works; constructs water supply
            systems, wastewater disposable systems, and off-site
            drainage systems; supplies and installs electrical power and
            transformers; builds a container devanning area outside of
            the port and improves port container and airport cargo
            facilities; and implements the environmental management
            plan. The second component promotes investment and removes
            administrative bottlenecks to facilitate trade. It builds
            capacity by changing operational procedures, human
            resources, and international standards compliance in
            customs, excise, and preventive services; increasing private
            participation in the ports and harbor authority; converting
            the civil aviation authority into a regulatory agency and
            operationalizing open skies; modernizing immigration
            services regulations and operating procedure; providing
            country and investment support to the investment promotion
            center; funding expertise, equipment, training, and
            operational support to the free zones board; and manages the
            Gateway program.
